faqDescription: Somali Data Protection Authority helps individuals and organizations quickly find answers to common questions about data protection in Somalia.
stillHaveQuestionsDescription: Contact us at info@dpa.gov.so or chat live with us.

faqs.question: What is personal data?
faqs.answer: Personal data is any information relating to an identified or identifiable person, such as names, ID numbers, email addresses, health records, or location data.

faqs.question: What are my rights under the Data Protection Act?
faqs.answer: You have the right to access your data, request corrections or deletion, object to processing, and more.

faqs.question: Do I need to register as a data controller?
faqs.answer: Yes. If your organization collects or processes personal data of Somali residents, you must register. See the Services section for requirements.

faqs.question: How do I report a data breach?
faqs.answer: Use the Data Breach Notification Form and submit it within 72 hours to breaches@dpa.gov.so. Full instructions are under the Services page.

faqs.question: Can I transfer data outside Somalia?
faqs.answer: Yes, but only with prior DPA approval and appropriate safeguards. Refer to the Cross‑Border Transfer Application section.

faqs.question: What is a DPO and who needs one?
faqs.answer: A Data Protection Officer (DPO) is required for organizations conducting large‑scale or sensitive data processing. Learn how to appoint a DPO in our Services.

faqs.question: How long does it take to process my request or complaint?
faqs.answer: Typically, you’ll receive a response within 5–15 business days, depending on the nature of your request.
